notesStmt.note: Title from rubric (f. 1r) and colophon (f. 2r), written without sandhi in both cases (gaṇapati atharvaśīraṣaṃ), and corrected by cataloger.
2 leaves foliated 1-2, upper left and lower right verso.
Scribe is Cintāmaṇa with the family name (upanāma) of Maktuṇa (f. 2r).
Mistakes blacked out; some corrections in margins.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of protective rites, mantras, and praises associated with the name Gaṇapati; purported to be from the Atharvaveda (f. 2r) though likely written in the late medieval period; dedicated to the deity Gaṇeśa, though manuscript identifies itself as an Upaniṣad (f. 2r).

msItem.title: Gaṇapatyatharvaśīrṣa
गणपत्यथर्वशीर्ष
msItem.colophon: Colophon: ity upaniṣat // ity atharvaṇavede gaṇapat[ya]tharvaśīraṣaṃ samāptaṃ // śrīgajānanārpaṇamastu // oṃ maktuṇopanāmakaciṃtāmaṇena likhitaṃ // svārthaṃ parārthaṃ ca // (f. 2r).
